"Correlation Among the Television Arts" (an exploration of
the organic interrelationships among the contributing arts to
television.) BORGERS, Edward W.
(Untitled) The parts of a program format which should be
carried by an educational FM radio station to serve local com¬
munity and needs of the area population. ANTOUN, Kathryn
Experience with and Utilization of
Methods, Techniques and Materials
Equipment and systems: "A Procedural and Cost Analysis Study
of Media in Instructional Systems Development—Michigan State
University" Sponsorship: U.S. Office of Education. BARSON, John
"Television Adaptation of the Audio-Visual-Lingual Approach to
the Teaching of Beginning College French" (experiment in
adaptation of the audio-lingual system of language instruction
to television and the learning of college students who are non¬
language majors) BOYLE, James R.
"Use of Remote Unit in Teacher Supervision" (use of video tape
to record class, followed by showing film to teacher and discuss¬
ing ways the instruction may be improved.) FRENCH, Joseph L.
"Investigating TV Distribution of Visual Aids on the University
of Utah Campus by Low-Power UHF" Sponsorship: U.S. Office of
Education. GORDON, Oakley
"University of Texas—Monterey (Mexico) Technical Institute
Cooperative CCTV Project" (exploring the possibilities of dub¬
bing U.T. course lectures into Spanish and using them at the
Monterey Institute) Sponsorship: Ford Foundation. MEANEY, John W.
"Context of Instructional Television" (consultant to project
directed by Wilbur. Schramm.) Sponsorship: U.S. Office of
Education. PARKER, Edwin B.
"The Construction and Use of Communications Media Materials in
Developing Countries" (will include recommended procedures and
materials for developing skills and communications techniques
in these countries.) SANDERSON, Richard A.
